title: Oauth2 not available
content:
I have successfully added three personal gmail accounts to thunderbird, but cannot add my google business/workspace account.

When i try to login, it says "Authentication Error".

I had to recently upgrade my google workspace account with 2 factor authorization.

I looked on the forums, and it described that i have to select Oauth2 as the "authentication method" - but it is not available on the drop down menu.

I checked for my personal accounts - the oauth2 is there is an authentication method, just not when i try to login with the workspace account. I am relatively sure this is causing the issue, as google does not allow the normal logins from 3rd party clients. But I don't know why it is not there as an option for my workspace account.

title: NOT WORKING: Changing the order of account mail check
content:
I have 4 email accounts set up in Thunderbird (all Gmail), and I can't seem to change the order of which is checked first when fetching new mail. I tried adjusting the order in Account settings, I've tried manually updating the prefs.js mail.accountmanager.accounts parameter. Nothing changes. The only thing I can say is unsual about my setup is at some point I changed the username to one or two of my accounts, so even though I only have 4 accounts, my prefs.js lists 6, and 2 of those (account 6 & 4, and 5 & 3) seem redundant but I'm afraid to manually modify the settings. Here's what it looks like. I want account 6/4 to be 2nd, but nothing I do seems to work.

user_pref("mail.account.account1.identities", "id1"); user_pref("mail.account.account1.server", "server1"); user_pref("mail.account.account2.server", "server2"); user_pref("mail.account.account3.identities", "id2"); user_pref("mail.account.account3.server", "server3"); user_pref("mail.account.account4.server", "server4"); user_pref("mail.account.account5.identities", "id3"); user_pref("mail.account.account5.server", "server5"); user_pref("mail.account.account6.identities", "id4"); user_pref("mail.account.account6.server", "server6"); user_pref("mail.account.lastKey", 6); user_pref("mail.accountmanager.accounts", "account1,account6,account3,account5,account2,account4"); user_pref("mail.accountmanager.defaultaccount", "account1"); user_pref("mail.accountmanager.localfoldersserver", "server2");

title: Adding an account and android
content: Good morning. Problem 1. I've been using Thunderbird for a very long time. Everything has always been fine. But recently, I've been having trouble sending email from one of my accounts. When I try to send a message, a message appears: enter the password for the user... Entering the password doesn't help, and another message appears asking me to contact the network administrator. I contacted them, but they didn't find the cause of the problem, but they suggested changing the password, which I did, and reinstalling Thunderbird, which I didn't do for fear of losing all my email. Changing the password helped for maybe two weeks, and then the problem started all over again. The problem only affects one email address and only on one computer. Sending messages from that address on Android works without any problems. Problem 2. I installed Thunderbird on my Android phone and encountered a problem when adding two accounts: the first installed without a problem, but I can't install the second one because every time I try, I get a message that the incoming mail server check failed - unknown error 42. Problem 3. I'm trying to install the program on my second phone - it downloads 99% from the Google Play Store and that's it. Is there any way to solve these problems, or should I change my email program? Best regards, Andrzej Witkowski

title: Password protection of individual e-mails
content: I am looking for a way to protect specific e-mails from being viewed from the list of e-mails, i.e. when the laptop has shut down due to inactivity and someone else opens it again and the Thunderbird window is still open. Albeit the TB password, once in the programme all e-mails are easy to view. Critical, individual e-mails could be protectes. I can do that when using a web browser for the mail provider (instead of the TB software) with a plugin Mailvelope (which unfortunately will discontinue soon). What programms could I use instead? this is NOT about end-to-end encryption, but individual protection of mails, e.g. with a password (or key) shared with the addressee alone. Any ideas or suggestions? thanks Robert

title: Thunderbird address book seems empty after migration to new laptop
content: Hi all, After an emergency transfer of data to a new laptop for my sister there are no more contacts in her Thunderbird address book. Here are the details: Since two weeks the old laptop will no longer start up windows, no rescue methods work, only CMD is functioning. So I copied all relevant data, including Thunderbird profiles, to an external hard drive, from which I later copied said data to a brand new laptop. It took some renaming of the profiles to make her mails appear but her address book remains empty. As far as I can tell at least some of the necessary files are where they're supposed to be: there is an abook.mab.bak file in her profile but no abook.mab. There are also a bunch of abook.sqlite files. The date stamp on the sqlite file seems correct (1 August) but the one on the mab.bak is from 2020. I've been searching through the old laptop HD with CMD but I don't really know where or how to look (I use linux on my own gear so windows is exotic territory for me). Any help is more than welcome.

title: Thunderbird not downloading messages
content:
I am using Thunderbird for e-mail in both Windows and Linux. The version is 140.1.1esr in Windows and 115.8.0esr in Linux (I didn't check that now, but that's what it is supposed to be for Xubuntu 22.04).

Something like one month ago, I started having problems with both. Thunderbird wouldn't update inbox when I started it, except for some rare occasions. In Windows, it claims it connects to the server, but in Linux, it says it cannot.

All this time, I have had no issues using e-mail on my smart phone with different client program. Thus, this is not about the service but about the client program.

I am using IMAP and port 993 for incoming server and port 465 for outgoing server. Authentication is done using password and encryption is SSL/TLS.

I don't remember if I had installed some update right before this started.

What makes this especially weird to me is that the problem started in two different setups roughly the same time.
creator: antti.garding

title: Thunderbird shows old printer being not in Windows Printer List

title: Unable to load subscribe folders list - times out and is empty
content: I have a user that can't get their list of folders to populate in the Subscribe settings. They have updated Thunderbird, uninstalled, removed their AppData\Romaing\Thunderbird folder to delete any settings leftover from the old install, installed the most recent version, and they still can't get the folder list in Susbscribe to populate. Their account connects to our email server and outgoing servers just fine, as they are able to pull down their Inbox with the messages, they receive new messages sent to their account, and they can send emails out of Thunderbird. So, Thunderbird just can't get the list of folders to subscribe to. I can see Thunderbird login correctly and issue the Fetch command to get the Inbox. The subscribe folders list eventually "times-out" and the activity manager also shows the error "Connection to server.example.com server timed out". As I said though, the server settings for the user are correct and the incoming connection works just fine and can pull in new emails without a problem.
creator: heisner05

title: Indice corrotto, è un problema di progetto e irrisolvibile?
content: Ho perso 5 mesi di messaggi archiviati. Eseguo regolarmente due backup. Il primo consiste nell'avere la cartella locale, che contiene i file dei messaggi, sotto Dropbox, in questo modo ho un aggiornamento costante e quasi istantaneo nel cloud. Il secondo è una copia settimanale di tutte le cartelle importanti (tra cui la cartella locale con i messaggi) su hd esterno. A quanto pare, questo sistema non garantisce contro i difetti di Thunderbird. Oggi ho scoperto che nella cartella Archivio del 2025, un messaggio email non veniva visualizzato. Per farla breve, ho riparato il file indice ed ho scoperto che i messaggi da febbraio a giugno sono scomparsi. Non è servito cancellare il file 2025.msf e far ripartire Thunderbird, non è servito il roll-back di Dropbox a date via via più distanti e non è servito il restore dall'hd esterno. Il problema è probabilmente nato a febbraio, Thunderbird non lo segnala, ad ogni archiviazione di un nuovo messaggio il file contenitore si corrompeva sempre di più. Il file corrotto è finito in Dropbox ed anche sul backup esterno. Quindi, se questa procedura di backup evidentemente non serve, che cosa si deve fare per evitare la perdita dei dati? Devo manualmente cancellare tutti i *.msf ad ogni chiusura? Mi sembra assurdo. Come posso tutelarmi dalla corruzione del file se Thunderbird non segnala alcun errore? Ritengo che sia molto importante introdurre un sistema di auto sorveglianza di Thunderbird, che so... qualcosa come un doppio indice, seguendo come esempio il sistema delle tabelle di allocazione file nei dischi. Sebbene io sia quasi certo che i miei messaggi sia impossibile recuperarli, chiedo comunque: suggerimenti?
creator: Gimli

title: Start Thunderbird and Firefox starts
content:
On wife's laptop, got side tracked and said ok to Upgrade (thinking it was Mozilla Firefox) but it was actually for Thunderbird Email app. Realizing my mistake I quickly closed Thunderbird before it did the upgrade. We like the layout of version 102.15.1 and it's still running 102.15.1 on new starts. But now when we start Thunderbird, the Firefox browser immediately starts and goes to the below link, https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.0/whatsnew/?locale=en-US&version=115.10.1&channel=release&oldversion=102.15.1

Have to close or minimize firefox to see Thunderbird. Need to find a way to get rid of this browser startup on Thunderbird. I've tried these below but they did not stop it.

/* added this registry entry */ HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Mozilla\Thunderbird 

   "DisableAppUpdate"=dword:00000001

/* also added a policies.json with the below text */ { "policies": { "DisableAppUpdate": true} } 

      /* in this folder */

C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\ 

        /* and in */

C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution\ /* Edit Add, oh also I never check the */ When Thunderbird launches show the start page in Message area /* But even if it's checked it goes to another page not the link above */

/* The update-settings.ini has the below in it */

If you modify this file updates may fail.
Do not modify this file.

[Settings] ACCEPTED_MAR_CHANNEL_IDS=thunderbird-comm-release

/* Anybody know where I can track down and delete where this browser startup if coming from? */

title: emails with no subject and with a load of encoding information instead of just the message. (bitdefender)
content: Thunderbird recently started showing some emails with no subject and with a load of encoding information instead of just the message. This is odd, random emails with no apparent connection between them (sender, sending software, etc.) The emails themselves appear perfectly normal if viewed on an iPhone and also in MailWasher which fronts my email downloading but only exhibits these issues in Thunderbird (version Eclipse 140.1.1esr 64bit I've tried repairing the folder, and repairing the text encoding. I've tried alt-V and adjusting the headers and message body settings (as suggested in a similar fault fix from 6 years ago) with no improvement. Any ideas what might be causing this, please? I've attached a snapshot of the start of a typical email (can't fit it all in a screenshot) Thanks... Chris

title: downloading from Gmail to Thunderbird
content:
I have just upgraded my computer from Windows 10 to Windows 11. Due to hardware complications (e.g., new motherboard) I had this done at a shop. I took the computer in about noon on Wednesday, July 30. The upgrade to W-11 finally happened on Monday afternoon, August 11. During that period I received 83 emails to my Gmail account, which of course were not downloaded to Thunderbird, and also sent 13 -- all directly to/from the web Gmail site. Since the activation of W-11 I have received 19 emails and sent 6 -- still all directly from the web Gmail site. Due to additional hardware issues, my computer did not come home until this (Thursday, August 14) afternoon. After I got it hooked up, and running, I brought up Thunderbird. It has downloaded the 83 received + 13 sent, from 7/30 through 8/11, but not done anything with the 19 received + 6 sent emails since then. When I turned Thunderbird off and back on -- or the entire computer off and back on, it has repeated this behavior. Currently I have 332 (83*4) received messages sitting in my inbox, and 52 (13*4) sent messages sitting in my sent box.

What do I need to do, to stop it from repeating this 7/30-8/11 download; and more importantly /start/ downloading messages since then? I feel fairly confident that the timing of the switchover from W-10 to W-11 is not coincidental; and that there is something I need to do in Thunderbird under W-11, to correct this behavior.

All advice will be greatly appreciated.

Thank you, Franklin Coleman
creator: franklinccoleman
